Attributes¶

DnnLik._DnnLik__model_callbacks_inputs¶

Private attribute corresponding to the input argument model_callbacks_inputs. If the object is initialized from input arguments it is set to the value of model_callbacks_inputs, otherwise it is set from the file corresponding to the DnnLik.input_summary_json_file attribute.

  • type: list

  • list items type: str and/or dict (see model_callbacks_inputs for the dictionary structure).

DnnLik._DnnLik__model_compile_inputs¶

Private attribute corresponding to the input argument model_compile_inputs. If the object is initialized from input arguments it is set to the value of model_compile_inputs if present, otherwise it is constructed setting the loss to "mse" and the metrics to ["mse","mae","mape","msle"]. If the object is imported from files the attribute is set from the file corresponding to the DnnLik.input_summary_json_file attribute.

  • type: dict (see model_compile_inputs for the dictionary structure).

DnnLik._DnnLik__model_data_inputs¶

Private attribute corresponding to the input argument model_data_inputs. If the object is initialized from input arguments it is set to the value of model_data_inputs otherwise is set from the file corresponding to the DnnLik.input_summary_json_file attribute. If the number of validation and test data points are smaller than one, then they are treated as fractions of the corresponding number of training points and are replaced by the absolute numbers. If "scaleX"`, ``"scaleY", and/or "weighted" are not specified than they are set to False.

  • type: dict (see model_data_inputs for the dictionary structure).

DnnLik._DnnLik__model_define_inputs¶

Private attribute corresponding to the input argument model_define_inputs. If the object is initialized from input arguments it is set to the value of model_define_inputs otherwise is set from the file corresponding to the DnnLik.input_summary_json_file attribute. If "act_func_out_layer"`, ``"dropout_rate", and/or "batch_norm" are not specified than they are set to "linear", 0, and False, respectively.

  • type: dict (see model_define_inputs for the dictionary structure).

DnnLik._DnnLik__model_optimizer_inputs¶

Private attribute corresponding to the input argument model_optimizer_inputs. If the object is initialized from input arguments it is set to the value of model_optimizer_inputs, otherwise it is set from the file corresponding to the DnnLik.input_summary_json_file attribute. For all arguments of the optimizer that are not specified the default value is used.

  • type: str or dict (see model_optimizer_inputs for the dictionary structure).

DnnLik._DnnLik__model_train_inputs¶

Private attribute corresponding to the input argument model_train_inputs. If the object is initialized from input arguments it is set to the value of model_train_inputs, otherwise it is set from the file corresponding to the DnnLik.input_summary_json_file attribute.

  • type: dict (see model_train_inputs for the dictionary structure).

DnnLik._DnnLik__resources_inputs¶

Private attribute corresponding to the input argument resources_inputs. If the input argument is not given, i.e. it is set to the default value None, the dictionary is set by the DnnLik.__set_resources private method.

  • type: dict (see resources_inputs for the dictionary structure).

DnnLik.act_func_out_layer¶

String representing the activation function in the output layer. It is set from the DnnLik.__model_define_inputs dictionary.

  • type: str

DnnLik.active_gpus¶

List specifying the GPUs active in the current environment. For each GPU the list contains two strings with device ID and information, respectively. It is either set from the the DnnLik.__resources_inputs dictionary if available or initialized by the DnnLik.__set_resources method.

  • type: list

  • shape: (n_active_gpus,2)

DnnLik.available_cpu¶

List specifying the CPU resources. It contains three strings with device ID, specifications, number of cores, respectively. It is either set from the the DnnLik.__resources_inputs dictionary if available or initialized by the DnnLik.__set_resources method.

  • type: list

  • shape: (3,)

DnnLik.available_gpus¶

List specifying the GPUs available on the current machine. For each GPU the list contains two strings with device ID and information, respectively. It is either set from the the DnnLik.__resources_inputs dictionary if available or initialized by the DnnLik.__set_resources method.

  • type: list

  • shape: (n_available_gpus,2)

DnnLik.batch_norm¶

If True, then batch normalization layers are added after the input layer and between each pair of hidden layers. It is set from the the DnnLik.__model_define_inputs dictionary (False if not specified in the input argument model_define_inputs).

  • type: bool

DnnLik.batch_size¶

Specifies the default batch size used for training, evaluation, and prediction. It is set from the DnnLik.__model_train_inputs dictionary.

  • type: int

DnnLik.callbacks¶

List of tf.keras.callbacks objects. It is set by the DnnLik.__set_callbacks method by evaluating the corresponding strings in the DnnLik.callbacks_strings attribute.

  • type: list of tf.keras.callbacks objects

DnnLik.callbacks_strings¶

List of tf.keras.callbacks strings. It is set by the DnnLik.__set_callbacks method by parsing the content of the DnnLik.__model_callbacks_inputs dictionary.

  • type: list of str

DnnLik.data¶

The Data object used by the DnnLik one for data management. It is set to the value of the input ärgument data if passed. Otherwise, the DnnLik.__set_data sets it to a Data object imported from the DnnLik.input_data_file.

  • type: Data object

DnnLik.data_max¶

Dictionary containing the maximum of the DNNLikelihood computed with the DNNLik.model_compute_max method. It contains "X" and "Y" items corresponding to the X and Y values at the maximum of the DNNLik.model_predict_scalar function.

  • type: dict with the following structure:

    • “X” (value type: numpy.ndarray, shape: (ndims,))

      Numpy array with the values of parameters at the model maximum.

    • “Y” (value type: float)

      Value of the model at its maximum

DnnLik.data_profiled_max¶

To be written

DnnLik.dropout_rate¶

Specifies the dropout rate for the Dropout layers. It is set from the DnnLik.__model_define_inputs dictionary. If the value is 0 no Dropout layers are added to the model.

  • type: float

DnnLik.dtype¶

Required data type for the generation of the train/validation/test datasets. The attribute is set by the DnnLik.__set_dtype methods to the value of the dtype if it is not None and to "float64" otherwise.

  • type: str

DnnLik.ensemble_folder¶

If the DnnLik object is a member of a DnnLikEnsemble object, then this attribute is set to the parent directory of DnnLik.output_folder, where, by default, the DnnLikEnsemble object is stored (and corresponding to the DnnLikEnsemble.ensemble_folder attribute of the DnnLikEnsemble object). The attribute is by the DnnLik.__check_define_ensemble_folder method based on the value of the DnnLik.ensemble_name attribute. If the latter is None, then also DnnLik.output_folder attribute is set to None, the DnnLik object is considered “standalone”, and the DnnLik.standalone is set to True.

  • type: str or None

DnnLik.ensemble_name¶

Attribute corresponding to the input argument ensemble_name. If the DnnLik object is a member of a DnnLikEnsemble object, then the latter automatically passes the input argument ensemble_name when it creates the DnnLik object. The attribute is by the DnnLik.__check_define_ensemble_folder method. If the input argument is None, then also the attribute is set to None, the DnnLik object is considered “standalone”, and the DnnLik.standalone is set to True.

  • type: str or None

DnnLik.epochs_available¶

Number if epochs for which DnnLik.model has been trained. It is updated by the DnnLik.model_train method after each training.

  • type: int

DnnLik.epochs_required¶

Number of epochs required for the training. The first time the object is created it is set to the value of the “epochs” item in the DnnLik.__model_train_inputs dictionary. It can be manually changed before calling the DnnLik.model_train method to train for more epochs. Notice that each call to the DnnLik.model_train method only trains for a number of epochs equal to the difference between DnnLik.epochs_required and DnnLik.epochs_available (set by the private method DnnLik.__set_epochs_to_run).

  • type: int

DnnLik.fig_base_title¶

Common title for generated figures generated by the DNNLik.generate_fig_base_title method and including information on

  • DNNLik.ndims

  • DNNLik.ndims

  • DNNLik.ndims

  • DNNLik.ndims

  • type: list of str

DnnLik.figures_list¶

List of absolute paths to the generated figures.

  • type: list of str

DnnLik.pars_labels_auto¶

Copy of the DnnLik.data.pars_labels_auto attribute of the Data object used for data management (see the doc of the Data.pars_labels_auto attribute).

  • type: list

  • shape: (ndims,)

DnnLik.gpu_mode¶

Attribute set by the DnnLik.__set_resources method and indicating whether the object has GPU support (True) or not (False). If the object is a mamber of a DnnLikEnsemble one, then the attribute is set from the DnnLik.__resources_inputs attribute.

  • type: bool

DnnLik.hidden_layers¶

Attribute corresponding to the “hidden_layer” item of the DnnLik.__model_define_inputs attribute. It is a list with hidden layers specifications. All hidden layers in the module are Dense layers. Each hidden layer is represented by a list with number of nodes (int), activation function (str), and (optionally) initializer (str)

  • type: list

  • shape: (n_hidden_layers,3)

DnnLik.history¶

Attribute corresponding to the “history” dictionary of the History object returned by the tf.keras.Model.fit method. It contains a list with the history of values of metrics for each training epoch. The contento of this dictionary is saved into the file DnnLik.output_history_json_file.

  • type: dict with the following structure:

    • “metric” (value type: list)

      List with values of metric for each epoch. This key is present for all metric with the corresponding full name of the metric, such as, for instance, "mean_squared_error_best", etc. Metrics include ``"loss".

    • “lr” (value type: float)

      List with values of the learning rate at each epoch.

DnnLik.idx_test¶

Numpy array with the integer position (indices) of the test data points in the data arrays contained in DnnLik.data.data_X and DnnLik.data.data_Y. The same indices are also stored in the “idx_test” item of the Data.data_dictionary object DnnLik.data.

  • type: numpy.ndarray

  • shape: (n_points_test,)

DnnLik.idx_train¶

Numpy array with the integer position (indices) of the training data points in the data arrays contained in DnnLik.data.data_X and DnnLik.data.data_Y. The same indices are also stored in the “idx_train” item of the Data.data_dictionary object DnnLik.data.

  • type: numpy.ndarray

  • shape: (n_points_train,)

DnnLik.idx_val¶

Numpy array with the integer position (indices) of the validation data points in the data arrays contained in DnnLik.data.data_X and DnnLik.data.data_Y. The same indices are also stored in the “idx_val” item of the DnnLik.data.data_dictionary attribute.

  • type: numpy.ndarray

  • shape: (n_points_val,)

DnnLik.input_data_file¶

Absolute path corresponding to the input argument input_data_file. If the latter is not passed, DnnLik.input_data_file is set to DnnLik.data.input_file.

  • type: str

DnnLik.input_files_base_name¶

Absolute path with base file name corresponding to the input argument input_summary_json_file without the “_summary” suffix. Whenever this attribute is not None, it is used to set all input file names and to reconstructed the object from input files (see the DnnLik.__init__ method for details).

  • type: str or None

DnnLik.input_history_json_file¶

Absolute path to the .json file containing saved DnnLik.history attribute (see the DnnLik.save_history_json method for details). It is automatically generated from the attribute DnnLik.input_files_base_name. When the latter is None, the attribute is set to None.

  • type: str or None

DnnLik.input_idx_h5_file¶

Absolute path to the .h5 file containing saved data indices (see the DnnLik.save_data_indices method for details). It is automatically generated from the attribute DnnLik.input_files_base_name. When the latter is None, the attribute is set to None.

  • type: str or None

DnnLik.input_log_file¶

Absolute path to the .log file containing saved DnnLik method for details). It is automatically generated from the attribute DnnLik.input_files_base_name. When the latter is None, the attribute is set to None.

  • type: str or None

DnnLik.input_predictions.h5_file¶

Absolute path to the .json file containing saved DnnLik.predictions (see the DnnLik.save_data_indices method for details). It is automatically generated from the attribute DnnLik.input_files_base_name. When the latter is None, the attribute is set to None.

  • type: str or None

DnnLik.input_scalers_pickle_file¶

Absolute path to the .pickle file containing saved data standard scalers (see the DnnLik.save_scalers method for details). It is automatically generated from the attribute DnnLik.input_files_base_name. When the latter is None, the attribute is set to None.

  • type: str or None

DnnLik.input_summary_json_file¶

Absolute path to the .json file containing saved DnnLik object (see the DnnLik.save_summary_json method for details). It is automatically generated from the attribute DnnLik.input_files_base_name. When the latter is None, the attribute is set to None.

  • type: str or None

DnnLik.input_tf_model_h5_file¶

Absolute path to the .h5 file containing saved tf.keras.Model corresponding to the DnnLik.model (see the DnnLik.save_summary_json method for details). It is automatically generated from the attribute DnnLik.input_files_base_name. When the latter is None, the attribute is set to None.

  • type: str or None

DnnLik.load_on_RAM¶

Attribute corresponding to the input argument load_on_RAM. If True all data available in the HDF5 dataset DnnLik.input_data_file are loaded into the RAM for faster generation of train/validation/test data. If False the HDF5 file is open in read mode and train/validation/test data are generated on demand.

  • type: str or None

DnnLik.log¶

Dictionary containing a log of the Data object calls. The dictionary has datetime strings as keys and actions as values. Actions are also dictionaries, containing details of the methods calls.

  • type: dict

  • keys: datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d-%H-%M-%S.%fZ")[:-3]

  • values: dict with the following structure:

    • “action” (value type: str)

      Short description of the action. possible values: "changed_output_folder", "created", ""loaded summary json"", "loaded history json", "loaded tf model h5", "loaded scalers h5", "loaded data indices h5", "loaded predictions json", "optimizer set", "loss set", "metrics set", "callbacks set", "computed sample weights", "defined scalers", "generated train data", "generated test data", "defined tf model", "compiled tf model", "built tf model", "trained tf model", "predicted with tf model", "computed maximum logpdf", "evaluated tf model", "saved figure", "computed predictions", "saved indices", "saved tf model json", "saved tf model h5", "saved tf model onnx", "saved history json", "saved summary json", "saved predictions json", "saved scalers h5", "saved model graph pdf".

    • “file name” (value type: str)

      File name of file involved in the action.

    • “file path” (value type: str)

      Path of file involved in the action.

    • “files names” (value type: list of str)

      List of file names of files involved in the action.

    • “files paths” (value type: list of str)

      List of paths of files involved in the action.

    • “optimizer” (value type: str)

      String corresponding to the attribute DnnLik.optimizer_string.

    • “loss” (value type: str)

      String corresponding to the attribute DnnLik.loss_string.

    • “metrics” (value type: list of str)

      List corresponding to the attribute DnnLik.metrics_string.

    • “callbacks” (value type: list of str)

      List corresponding to the attribute DnnLik.callbacks_strings.

    • “scaler X” (value type: bool)

      Boolean corresponding to the attribute DnnLik.scalerX_bool.

    • “scaler Y” (value type: bool)

      Boolean corresponding to the attribute DnnLik.scalerY_bool.

    • “data” (value type: list of str)

      List of data involved in the action. It could include the strings: “idx_train”, “X_train”, “Y_train”, “idx_val”, “X_val”, “Y_val”, “idx_test”, “X_test”, “Y_test”.

    • “npoints train” (value type: int)

      Number of training points corresponding to the attribute DnnLik.npoints_train.

    • “npoints val” (value type: int)

      Number of validation points corresponding to the attribute DnnLik.npoints_val.

    • “npoints test” (value type: int)

      Number of test points corresponding to the attribute DnnLik.npoints_test.

    • “model summary” (value type: list)

      List rendering a print of the model.summary() method of tf.keras.Model.

    • “gpu mode” (value type: bool)

      Boolean corresponding to the attribute DnnLik.gpu_mode.

    • “device id” (value type: str)

      String with the ID of the device on which model has been built (see the DnnLik.model_build method).

    • “epochs run” (value type: int)

      Number of epochs of the current training run.

    • “epochs total” (value type: int)

      Total number of training epochs.

    • “batch size” (value type: int)

      Batch size used for action (training, predicting, evaluating), corresponding to the attribute DnnLik.batch_size.

    • “training time” (value type: float)

      Training time in seconds of the last training.

    • “prediction time” (value type: float)

      Prediction time in seconds of the last prediction.

    • “evaluation time” (value type: float)

      Evaluation time in seconds of the last evaluation.

    • “npoints” (value type: int)

      Number of points involved in the corresponding action.

    • “optimizer” (value type: str)

      String representing the optimizer used to maximise the logpdf.

    • “optimization time” (value type: float)

      Time in second for computation of the maximum of logpdf.

    • “probability intervals” (value type: list)

      Probability intervals used for predictions.

    • “pars” (value type: list)

      Parameters involved in predictions.

    • “old folder” (value type: str)

      Previous path.

    • “new folder” (value type: str)

      New path.

DnnLik.loss¶

loss object. It is set by the DnnLik.__set_loss method by evaluating the corresponding strings in the DnnLik.loss_string attribute.

  • type: loss object

DnnLik.loss_string¶

String representing a loss object. It is set by the DnnLik.__set_loss method by parsing the content of the DnnLik.__model_compile_inputs dictionary.

  • type: str

DnnLik.metrics¶

List of metrics objects. It is set by the DnnLik.__set_metrics method by evaluating the corresponding strings in the DnnLik.metrics_string attribute.

  • type: list of metrics objects

DnnLik.metrics_string¶

List of metrics strings. It is set by the DnnLik.__set_metrics method by parsing the content of the DnnLik.__model_compile_inputs dictionary.

  • type: list of str

DnnLik.model¶

tf.keras.Model object representing the DNNLikelihood.

  • type: tf.keras.Model object

DnnLik.model_max¶

Dictionary containing the maximum of the DNNLikelihood computed with the DNNLik.model_compute_max method. It contains x and y values at the maximum of the DNNLik.model function. It is initialized to an empty dictionary {} when the DNNLik object is created.

  • type: dict with the following structure:

    • “x” (value type: numpy.ndarray, shape: (ndims,))

      Numpy array with the values of parameters at the model maximum.

    • “y” (value type: float)

      Value of the model at its maximum

DnnLik.model_profiled_max¶

To be written

DnnLik.name¶

Name of the DnnLik object generated from the name input argument. If None is passed, then name is assigned the value model_" + datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d-%H-%M-%S.%fZ")[:-3]+"_DNNLikelihood". It is used to generate output files names.

  • type: str

DnnLik.ndims¶

Number of dimensions of the input vector (i.e. number of parameters entering in the logpdf). It is automatically set to the corresponding attribute Data.ndims of the Data object DnnLik.data.

  • type: int

DnnLik.npoints_available¶

Total number of points available in the class:Data <DNNLikelihood.Data> object DnnLik.data, corresponding to the Data.npoints attribute.

  • type: int

DnnLik.npoints_test¶

Number of test points for the current model. It is set by the DnnLik.__init__ method by parsing the item "npoints" of the DnnLik.__model_data_inputs dictionary.

  • type: int

DnnLik.npoints_test_available¶

Total number of test points available in the class:Data <DNNLikelihood.Data> object DnnLik.data, computed as the rounded product of one minus Data.test_fraction and DnnLik.npoints_available.

  • type: int

DnnLik.npoints_train¶

Number of training points for the current model. It is set by the DnnLik.__init__ method by parsing the item "npoints" of the DnnLik.__model_data_inputs dictionary.

  • type: int

DnnLik.npoints_train_val_available¶

Total number of train plus validation points available in the class:Data <DNNLikelihood.Data> object DnnLik.data, computed as the rounded product of Data.test_fraction and DnnLik.npoints_available.

  • type: int

DnnLik.npoints_val¶

Number of validation points for the current model. It is set by the DnnLik.__init__ method by parsing the item "npoints" of the DnnLik.__model_data_inputs dictionary.

  • type: int

DnnLik.optimizer¶

tf.keras.optimizers object. It is set by the DnnLik.__set_optimizer method by evaluating the corresponding strings in the DnnLik.optimizer_string attribute.

  • type: tf.keras.optimizers object

DnnLik.optimizer_string¶

String representing a tf.keras.optimizers object. It is set by the DnnLik.__set_optimizer method by parsing the content of the DnnLik.__model_optimizer_inputs dictionary.

  • type: str

DnnLik.output_checkpoints_files¶

When the callback tf.keras.callbacks.ModelCheckpoint is present, this attribute represents the absolute path to the .h5 files containing model checkpoints. It is initialized to None by the DnnLik.__check_define_output_files method and automatically generated when needed by the DnnLik.__set_callbacks method from the attribute DnnLik.output_files_base_name.

  • type: str or None

DnnLik.output_checkpoints_folder¶

When the callback tf.keras.callbacks.ModelCheckpoint is present, this attribute represents the absolute path to the folder where the .h5 files containing model checkpoints are saved. It is initialized to None by the DnnLik.__check_define_output_files method and automatically generated when needed by the DnnLik.__set_callbacks method from the attribute DnnLik.output_folder.

  • type: str or None

DnnLik.output_figure_plot_losses_keras_file¶

When the callback livelossplot is present, this attribute represents the absolute path to the folder where the corresponding figures are saved. It is initialized to None by the DnnLik.__check_define_output_files method and automatically generated when needed by the DnnLik.__set_callbacks method from the attribute DnnLik.output_figures_base_file.

  • type: str or None

DnnLik.output_figures_base_file¶

Absolute path to the saved figures. It includes the base figure name and is automatically generated from the DnnLik.output_folder attribute.

  • type: str

DnnLik.output_figures_folder¶

Absolute path to the folder where figures are saved. It includes the base figure name and is automatically generated from the DnnLik.output_folder attribute.

  • type: str

DnnLik.output_files_base_name¶

Base name with absolute path of output files. It is automatically generated from the DnnLik.output_folder and DnnLik.name attributes.

  • type: str

DnnLik.output_folder¶

Absolute path corresponding to the input argument output_folder. If the latter is None, then output_folder is set to the code execution folder. If the folder does not exist it is created by the utils.check_create_folder function.

  • type: str

DnnLik.output_history_json_file¶

Absolute path to the .json file where the DnnLik.history attribute is saved (see the DnnLik.save_history_json method for details). It is automatically generated from the DnnLik.output_files_base_name attribute.

  • type: str

DnnLik.output_idx_h5_file¶

Absolute path to the .h5 file where the data indices are saved (see the DnnLik.save_data_indices method for details). It is automatically generated from the DnnLik.output_files_base_name attribute.

  • type: str

DnnLik.output_log_file¶

Absolute path to the .log file where the DnnLik.log is saved (see the DnnLik.save_log method for details). It is automatically generated from the DnnLik.output_files_base_name attribute.

  • type: str

DnnLik.output_predictions_h5_file¶

Absolute path to the .json file where the DnnLik.predictions attribute is saved (see the DnnLik.save_predictions_h5 method for details). It is automatically generated from the DnnLik.output_files_base_name attribute.

  • type: str

DnnLik.output_scalers_pickle_file¶

Absolute path to the .pickle file where the data standard scalers are saved (see the DnnLik.save_scalers method for details). It is automatically generated from the DnnLik.output_files_base_name attribute.

  • type: str

DnnLik.output_summary_json_file¶

Absolute path to the .json file where where part of the DnnLik object is saved (see the DnnLik.save_summary_json method for details). It is automatically generated from the DnnLik.output_files_base_name attribute.

  • type: str

DnnLik.output_tensorboard_log_dir¶

When the callback TensorBoard is present, this attribute represents the absolute path to the folder where log files are saved. It is automatically generated from the DnnLik.output_folder attribute.

  • type: str or None

DnnLik.output_tf_model_graph_pdf_file¶

Absolute path to the .pdf file where the model graph is saved (see the DnnLik.save_model_graph_pdf method for details). It is automatically generated from the DnnLik.output_files_base_name attribute.

  • type: str

DnnLik.output_tf_model_h5_file¶

Absolute path to the .h5 file where where the DnnLik.model object is saved (see the DnnLik.save_model_h5 method for details). It is automatically generated from the DnnLik.output_files_base_name attribute.

  • type: str

DnnLik.output_tf_model_json_file¶

Absolute path to the .json file where where the DnnLik.model object is saved (see the DnnLik.save_model_json method for details). It is automatically generated from the DnnLik.output_files_base_name attribute.

  • type: str

DnnLik.output_tf_model_onnx_file¶

Absolute path to the .onnx file where where the DnnLik.model object is saved in ONNX format (see the DnnLik.save_model_onnx method for details). It is automatically generated from the DnnLik.output_files_base_name attribute.

  • type: str

DnnLik.pars_bounds¶

Copy of the DnnLik.data.pars_bounds attribute of the Data object used for data management.

  • type: numpy.ndarray

  • shape: (ndims,2)

DnnLik.pars_bounds_train¶

Bounds on the parameters computed from their minimum and maximum values in the training dataset. This attribute could be used to constrain the prediction of the DNNLikelihood within a region where X training data were available. See the DNNLik.model_predict method for details.

  • type: numpy.ndarray

  • shape: (ndims,2)

DnnLik.pars_central¶

Copy of the DnnLik.data.pars_central attribute of the Data object used for data management.

  • type: numpy.ndarray

  • shape: (ndims,)

DnnLik.pars_labels¶

Copy of the DnnLik.data.pars_labels attribute of the Data object used for data management.

  • type: list

  • shape: (ndims,)

DnnLik.pars_pos_nuis¶

Copy of the DnnLik.data.pars_pos_nuis attribute of the Data object used for data management.

  • type: list or numpy.ndarray

  • shape: (n_nuis,)

DnnLik.pars_pos_poi¶

Copy of the DnnLik.data.pars_pos_poi attribute of the Data object used for data management.

  • type: list or numpy.ndarray

  • shape: (n_poi,)

DnnLik.pred_bounds_train¶

Maximum and minimum value of Y in training data. This attribute could be used to constrain the prediction of the DNNLikelihood within a region where Y training data were available. See the DNNLik.model_predict method for details.

  • type: numpy.ndarray

  • shape: (2,)

DnnLik.predictions¶

Nested dictionary containing all predictions generated by the DnnLik.model_compute_predictions method. The contento of this dictionary is saved into the file DnnLik.output_predictions_h5_file.

  • type: dict with the following structure:

    • “HPDI” (value type: dict)

      Highest posterior density intervals (HPDI) for the parameters. This dictionary has the following structure:

      • “par” (value type: dict)

        Dictionary corresponding to parameter par. This dictionary has the following structure:

        • “pred” (value type: dict)

          Dictionary corresponding to the prediction computed reweighting distributions using the DNN prediction. Has the same structure as the item “true”.

        • “true” (value type: dict)

          Dictionary corresponding to the prediction computed using the original data. This dictionary has the following structure:

          • “test” (value type: dict)

            Dictionary corresponding to the prediction computed from test data. Has the same structure as the items “train” and “val”.

          • “train” (value type: dict)

            Dictionary corresponding to the prediction computed from test data. Has the same structure as the items “test” and “val”.

          • “val” (value type: dict)

            Dictionary corresponding to the prediction computed from test data. This dictionary has the following structure:

            • “Probability” (value type: dict)

              Dictionary with HPDI corresponding to the interval interval. Default intervals for the DnnLik.model_compute_predictions method are "0.5", "0.6826894921370859", "0.9544997361036416", and "0.9973002039367398". The latter three correspond to 1,2,3 standard deviations for a 1D normal distribution (obtained through the inference.CI_from_sigma function). This dictionary has the following structure:

              • “Bin width” (value type: float)

                Width of the binning used to compute the HPDI (see the inference.HPDI function for details). It gives an estimate of the uncertainty due to the algorithm for computing HPDI.

              • “Intervals” (value type: list of list)

                List of intervals of parameter values for the given probability.

              • “Number of bins” (value type: int)

                Number of bins used for the computation of HPDI (see the inference.HPDI function for details).

              • “Probability” (value type: float)

                Probability interval.

    • “HPDI_error” (value type: dict)

      Errors on the HPDI quantified as differences (absolute and relative) between the predictions of HPDI computed with input data and with DNN reweight. This dictionary has the following structure:

      • “par” (value type: dict)

        Dictionary corresponding to parameter par. This dictionary has the following structure:

        • “test” (value type: dict)

          Dictionary corresponding to the prediction computed from test data. Has the same structure as the items “train” and “val”.

        • “train” (value type: dict)

          Dictionary corresponding to the prediction computed from test data. Has the same structure as the items “test” and “val”.

        • “val” (value type: dict)

          Dictionary corresponding to the prediction computed from test data. This dictionary has the following structure:

          • “Probability” (value type: dict)

            Dictionary with HPDI corresponding to the interval interval. Default intervals for the DnnLik.model_compute_predictions method are "0.5", "0.6826894921370859", "0.9544997361036416", and "0.9973002039367398". The latter three correspond to 1,2,3 standard deviations for a 1D normal distribution (obtained through the inference.CI_from_sigma function). This dictionary has the following structure:

            • “Absolute error” (value type: list of list)

              List of absolute errors (computed as true-pred) for each boundary of the intervals (see the inference.HPDI_error function for details)

            • “Probability” (value type: float)

              Probability interval.

            • “Relative error” (value type: list of list)

              List of relative errors (computed as (true-pred)/true) for each boundary of the intervals (see the inference.HPDI_error function for details)

    • “KS” (value type: dict)

      Weighted Kolmogorov-Smirnov test statistics and p-values for two sample distributions for each parameter (see the inference.ks_w function for details). This dictionary has the following structure:

      • “Test vs pred on train” (value type: list, shape: (ndims,2))

        List of KS test statistics and p-value for each parameter for two sample KS test between input test data and DNN reweighted prediction on train data.

      • “Test vs pred on val” (value type: list, shape: (ndims,2))

        List of KS test statistics and p-value for each parameter for two sample KS test between input test data and DNN reweighted prediction on validation data.

      • “Train vs pred on train” (value type: list, shape: (ndims,2))

        List of KS test statistics and p-value for each parameter for two sample KS test between input train data and DNN reweighted prediction on train data.

      • “Val vs pred on test” (value type: list, shape: (ndims,2))

        List of KS test statistics and p-value for each parameter for two sample KS test between input validation data and DNN reweighted prediction on test data.

    • “KS medians” (value type: dict)

      Median over parameters of the KS p-values for two sample distributions. This dictionary has the following structure:

      • “Test vs pred on train” (value type: float)

        Median over parameters of the p-values for two sample KS test between input test data and DNN reweighted prediction on train data.

      • “Test vs pred on val” (value type: float)

        Median over parameters of the p-values for two sample KS test between input test data and DNN reweighted prediction on validation data.

      • “Train vs pred on train” (value type: float)

        Median over parameters of the p-values for two sample KS test between input train data and DNN reweighted prediction on train data.

      • “Val vs pred on test” (value type: float)

        Median over parameters of the p-values for two sample KS test between input validation data and DNN reweighted prediction on test data.

    • “Metrics on scaled data” (value type: dict)

      Value of all metrics (loss and metrics) evaluated on scaled data for train/val/test data. This dictionary has the following structure:

      • “metric_best” (value type: float)

        Value of each metric evaluated on train data. This key is present for all metric with the corresponding full name of the metric, such as, for instance, "mean_squared_error_best", etc. Metrics include ``"loss".

      • “test_metric_best” (value type: float)

        Value of each metric evaluated on test data. This key is present for all metric with the corresponding full name of the metric, such as, for instance, "test_mean_squared_error_best", etc. Metrics include ``"loss".

      • “val_metric_best” (value type: float)

        Value of each metric evaluated on validation data. This key is present for all metric with the corresponding full name of the metric, such as, for instance, "val_mean_squared_error_best", etc. Metrics include ``"loss".

    • “Metrics on unscaled data” (value type: dict)

      Value of all metrics (loss and metrics) evaluated on original data for train/val/test data. This dictionary has the same structure of the previous one with all keys having the suffix “_unscaled”.

    • “Prediction time” (value type: float)

      Averege prediction time per point in second with batch size equal to DnnLik.batch_size.

  • schematic example:

    {'HPDI': {'par_1': {'pred': {'test': {'prob_1': {'Bin width': float,
                                                 'Intervals': list,
                                                 'Number of bins': int,
                                                 'Probability': float
                                                },
                                      ...,
                                      {'prob_n': ...
                                      },
                             'train': ...,
                             'val': ...
                            },
                    'true': ...},
          ...,
          'par_n': ...
         },
 'HPDI_error': {'par_1': {'test': {'prob_1': {'Absolute error': list,
                                              'Probability': float,
                                              'Relative error': list
                                             },
                                   ...,
                                   {'prob_n': ...
                                   },
                          'train': ...,
                          'val': '...
                         },
                ...,
                'par_n': ...
               },
 'KS': {'Test vs pred on train': list,
        'Test vs pred on val': list,
        'Train vs pred on train': list,
        'Val vs pred on test': list},
 'KS medians': {'Test vs pred on train': float,
                'Test vs pred on val': float,
                'Train vs pred on train': float,
                'Val vs pred on test': float},
 'Metrics on scaled data': {'loss_best': float,
                            'mean_absolute_error_best': float,
                            ...
                           },
 'Metrics on unscaled data': {'loss_best_unscaled': float,
                              'mean_absolute_error_best_unscaled': float,
                              ...
                             },
 'Prediction time': float}
DnnLik.same_data¶

Attribute corresponding to the input argument same_data. If True, all the DnnLik objects part of a DnnLikEnsemble one will share the same data. If false data will be generated differently for each DnnLik object. When the DnnLik.standalone is True, then this attribute is True by default and is not used.

  • type: bool

DnnLik.scalerX¶

StandardScaler for X data points fit to the training data DnnLik.X_train. Standard scalers are always defined together with training data. Whenever the DnnLik.scalerX_bool attribute is False the scaler is just a representation of the identity matrix.

  • type: StandardScaler object

DnnLik.scalerX_bool¶

If True then the StandardScaler for the X data points is fit to the training data DnnLik.X_train, otherwise it is set to the identity matrix. It is set by the DnnLik.__set_model_hyperparameters method by parsing the item "scalerX" of the DnnLik.__model_data_inputs dictionary.

  • type: bool

DnnLik.scalerY¶

StandardScaler for Y data points fit to the training data DnnLik.Y_train. Standard scalers are always defined together with training data. Whenever the DnnLik.scalerY_bool attribute is False the scaler is just a representation of the identity matrix.

  • type: StandardScaler object

DnnLik.scalerY_bool¶

If True then the StandardScaler for the Y data points is fit to the training data DnnLik.Y_train, otherwise it is set to the identity matrix. It is set by the DnnLik.__set_model_hyperparameters method by parsing the item "scalerY" of the DnnLik.__model_data_inputs dictionary.

  • type: bool

DnnLik.seed¶

Attribute corresponding to the input argument seed. If the latter is None then the attribute value is set to 1. It is used by the DnnLik.__set_seed method to initialize the numpy and TensorFlow random state.

  • type: int

DnnLik.standalone¶

If True the DnnLik object is not part of a DnnLikEnsemble one. It is set by the DnnLik.__check_define_ensemble_folder method based on the value of the DnnLik.ensemble_name attribute. If the latter is None then the attribute is set to True.

  • type: bool

DnnLik.verbose¶

Attribute corresponding to the input argument verbose. It represents the verbosity mode of the DnnLik.__init__ method and the default verbosity mode of all class methods that accept a verbose argument. See Verbosity mode.

  • type: bool or int

DnnLik.W_train¶

Numpy array with the weights of the training points computed by the DnnLik.compute_sample_weights method. If DnnLik.weighted is True then the weights are computed automatically when generating training data by calling the DnnLik.compute_sample_weights method with default parameters. Alternatively, the latter method can be called manually with custom arguments.

  • type: numpy.ndarray

  • shape: (npoints_train,)

DnnLik.weighted¶

If True then, when generating training data, weights for the X data points are computed automatically (with default parameters) by the DnnLik.compute_sample_weights method. It is set by the DnnLik.__set_model_hyperparameters method by parsing the item "weighted" of the DnnLik.__model_data_inputs dictionary. If True the DnnLik.model_train method calls the tf.keras.Model.fit method with argument sample_weight equal to DnnLik.W_train.

  • type: bool

DnnLik.X_test¶

Numpy array with X test data points generated by the DnnLik.generate_test_data method.

  • type: numpy.ndarray

  • shape: (npoints_test,ndim)

DnnLik.X_train¶

Numpy array with X train data points generated by the DnnLik.generate_train_data method.

  • type: numpy.ndarray

  • shape: (npoints_train,ndim)

DnnLik.X_val¶

Numpy array with X validation data points generated by the DnnLik.generate_train_data method.

  • type: numpy.ndarray

  • shape: (npoints_val,ndim)

DnnLik.Y_test¶

Numpy array with Y test data points generated by the DnnLik.generate_test_data method.

  • type: numpy.ndarray

  • shape: (npoints_test,)

DnnLik.Y_train¶

Numpy array with Y train data points generated by the DnnLik.generate_train_data method.

  • type: numpy.ndarray

  • shape: (npoints_train,)

DnnLik.Y_val¶

Numpy array with Y validation data points generated by the DnnLik.generate_train_data method.

  • type: numpy.ndarray

  • shape: (npoints_val,)
